Text: Pasang (game):  The game is often referred to as Pasang Emas which is actually a software implementation of the traditional board game.

Text: Pasang (game):  The object of this game is to acquire the most points by capturing black and white tokens on the board.

Text: Pasang (game):  Black tokens are worth 1 point, and white tokens are worth 2 points.

Text: Pasang (game):  The board is initially laid out with all 120 black and white tokens in one of over 30 traditional patterns.

Text: Pasang (game):  Players choose a piece called a "ka" which is used to capture the tokens on the board.

Text: Pasang (game):  As a note, the "kas" are the only mobile pieces in the game.

Text: Pasang (game):  Players must capture token(s) during their turn, or lose the game.

<Text: Pasang (game):  When all tokens have been captured from the board, the player with the most points is the winner.>
